intro: Peponopsis adhaerens, commonly known as the climbing cucumber, is a vine native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other cucurbits like pumpkins and melons. The plant is characterized by its tendrils that allow it to climb and spread along supports. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit, which resembles a small cucumber, is typically green and can be harvested when mature.
